alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Alleghany and northeastern Ashe Counties in northwestern North Carolina, southeastern Smyth, south central Wythe and Grayson Counties in southwestern Virginia through 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Volney, or over Mouth Of Wilson, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Independence... Lansing... Mouth Of Wilson... Sugar Grove... Ennice... Troutdale... and Volney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
